long_description: The. Author: William L. Sullivan. Softcover; 384 pages; black-and-white photographs and maps with short sections of full-color photographs. Navillus Press; copyright 2009. Each area entry offers detailed information on climate, wildlife, geology, history, hiking and backpacking, climbing, paddling, snoeshoeing and skiing. At-a-glance area chart sums up location, size, terrain, elevation, and recommended maps. Includes topographic maps of each area. Updated with all Oregon wilderness areas, including the additional 200,000 acres designated by Congress in 2009.
short_description: The Atlas of Oregon Wilderness offers 146 backpacking trips, 670 hiking trips, 170 snowshoe routes and additional routes for rock climbers and whitewater rafters.
